## Getting Started with Kaggle Kernels

1. Create an Kaggle account [here](https://www.kaggle.com/) if you don't have one yet

2. Verify your phone number [here](https://www.kaggle.com/settings) to get access to GPUs

3. Go to [Kaggle Kernels](https://www.kaggle.com/kernels)

4. Select `+ New Notebook`
<img src="img/create_notebook.png" alt="drawing" width="400"/>

5. Click `File` on the top left side of your Kaggle notebook, select `Import Notebook`
<img src="img/import_notebook.png" alt="drawing" width="400"/>

## Getting Started with Kaggle Kernels

6. Upload this notebook

7. On the right-hand side of your Kaggle notebook, find `Session options` and make sure:

  - `INTERNET` is enabled.

  - In the `ACCELERATOR` dropdown, choose the options starts with `GPU` when you're ready to use it (you can turn it on/off as you need it).
  
8. Follow the steps in the notebook

## Getting Started with Kaggle Datasets

1. On the right-hand side of your Kaggle notebook, find `Input` and click `+ Add Input`.

2. Choose `Datasets`. In the search bar, type your keyword (Example: 'cat-breed-mardhik') and click `+` to add the dataset if it is not added yet.

<img src="img/add_data1.png" alt="drawing" width="400"/>
